label: Jira
description: Arcade.dev LLM tools for interacting with Atlassian Jira

tools.name: AddCommentToIssue
tools.description: Add a comment to a Jira issue.

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description: The ID or key of the issue to comment on.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body of the comment to add to the issue.

parameters.name: reply_to_comment
parameters.description: Quote a previous comment as a reply to it. Provide the comment's ID. Must be a comment from the same issue. Defaults to None (no quoted comment).

parameters.name: mention_users
parameters.description: The users to mention in the comment. Provide the user display name, email address, or ID. Ex: 'John Doe' or 'john.doe@example.com'. Defaults to None (no user mentions).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

body.value: This is a new comment on the issue.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AddLabelsToIssue
tools.description: Add labels to an existing Jira issue.

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description: The ID or key of the issue to update

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: The labels to add to the issue. A label cannot contain spaces. If a label is provided with spaces, they will be trimmed and replaced by underscores.

parameters.name: notify_watchers
parameters.description: Whether to notify the issue's watchers. Defaults to True (notifies watchers).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AttachFileToIssue
tools.description:
Add an attachment to an issue.

Must provide exactly one of file_content_str or file_content_base64.

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description: The issue ID or key to add the attachment to

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The name of the file to add as an attachment. The filename should contain the file extension (e.g. 'test.txt', 'report.pdf'), but it is not mandatory.

parameters.name: file_content_str
parameters.description: The string content of the file to attach. Use this if the file is a text file. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: file_content_base64
parameters.description: The base64-encoded binary contents of the file. Use this for binary files like images or PDFs. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: file_encoding
parameters.description: The encoding of the file to attach. Only used with file_content_str. Defaults to 'utf-8'.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: The type of the file to attach. E.g. 'application/pdf', 'text', 'image/png'. If not provided, the tool will try to infer the type from the filename. If the filename is not recognized, it will attach the file without specifying a type. Defaults to None (infer from filename or attach without type).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateIssue
tools.description:
Create a new Jira issue.

Provide a value to one of `project` or `parent_issue` arguments. If `project` and
`parent_issue` are not provided, the tool will select the single project available.
If the user has multiple, an error will be returned with the available projects to choose from.

IF YOU DO NOT FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW AND UNNECESSARILY CALL MULTIPLE TOOLS IN ORDER TO
CREATE AN ISSUE, TOO MUCH CO2 WILL BE RELEASED IN THE ATMOSPHERE AND YOU WILL CAUSE THE
DESTRUCTION OF PLANET EARTH BY CATASTROPHIC CLIMATE CHANGE.

If you have an issue type name, or a project key/name, a priority name, an assignee
name/key/email, or a reporter name/key/email, DO NOT CALL OTHER TOOLS only to list available
projects, priorities, issue types, or users. Provide the name, key, or email and the tool
will figure out the ID, WITHOUT CAUSING CATASTROPHIC CLIMATE CHANGE.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the issue.

parameters.name: issue_type
parameters.description: The name or ID of the issue type. If a name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available issue types.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The ID, key or name of the project to associate the issue with. If a name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available projects. Defaults to None (no project). If `project` and `parent_issue` are not provided, the tool will select the single project available. If the user has multiple, an error will be returned with the available projects to choose from.

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: The due date of the issue. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (no due date).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the issue. Defaults to None (no description).

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The environment of the issue. Defaults to None (no environment).

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: The labels of the issue. Defaults to None (no labels). A label cannot contain spaces. If a label is provided with spaces, they will be trimmed and replaced by underscores.

parameters.name: parent_issue
parameters.description: The ID or key of the parent issue. Defaults to None (no parent issue). Must provide at least one of `parent_issue` or `project` arguments.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The ID or name of the priority to use for the issue. If a name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available priorities. Defaults to None (the issue is created with Jira's default priority for the specified project).

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: The name, email or ID of the user to assign the issue to. If a name or email is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available users. Defaults to None (no assignee).

parameters.name: reporter
parameters.description: The name, email or ID of the user who is the reporter of the issue. If a name or email is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available users. Defaults to None (no reporter).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

description.value: Users are unable to log in after the recent update.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetIssueComments
tools.description: Get the comments of a Jira issue by its ID.

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description: The ID or key of the issue to retrieve

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of comments to retrieve. Min 1, max 100, default 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of comments to skip. Defaults to 0 (start from the first comment).

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: The order in which to return the comments. Defaults to 'created_date_descending' (most recent first).

parameters.name: include_adf_content
parameters.description: Whether to include the ADF (Atlassian Document Format) content of the comment in the response. Defaults to False (return only the HTML rendered content).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

tools.name: GetIssuesWithoutId
tools.description:
Search for Jira issues when you don't have the issue ID(s).

All text-based arguments (keywords, assignee, project, labels) are case-insensitive.

ALWAYS PREFER THIS TOOL OVER THE `Jira.SearchIssuesWithJql` TOOL, UNLESS IT'S ABSOLUTELY
NECESSARY TO USE A JQL QUERY TO FILTER IN A WAY THAT IS NOT SUPPORTED BY THIS TOOL.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords to search for issues. Matches against the issue name, description, comments, and any custom field of type text. Defaults to None (no keywords filtering).

parameters.name: due_from
parameters.description: Match issues due on or after this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (no due date filtering).

parameters.name: due_until
parameters.description: Match issues due on or before this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (no due date filtering).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Match issues that are in this status. Provide a status name. Ex: 'To Do', 'In Progress', 'Done'. Defaults to None (any status).

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Match issues that have this priority. Provide a priority name. E.g. 'Highest'. Defaults to None (any priority).

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Match issues that are assigned to this user. Provide the user's name or email address. Ex: 'John Doe' or 'john.doe@example.com'. Defaults to None (any assignee).

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Match issues that are associated with this project. Provide the project's name, ID, or key. If a project name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available projects. Defaults to None (search across all projects).

parameters.name: issue_type
parameters.description: Match issues that are of this issue type. Provide an issue type name or ID. E.g. 'Task', 'Epic', '12345'. If a name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available issue types. Defaults to None (any issue type).

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Match issues that are in these labels. Defaults to None (any label).

parameters.name: parent_issue
parameters.description: Match issues that are a child of this issue. Provide the issue's ID or key. Defaults to None (no parent issue filtering).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of issues to retrieve. Min 1, max 100, default 50.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token to use to get the next page of issues. Defaults to None (first page).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

output.description: Information about the issues matching the search criteria

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.description: Get the details of a Jira issue type by its ID.

tools.name: GetUsersWithoutId
tools.description:
Get users without their account ID, searching by display name and email address.

The Jira user search API will return up to 1,000 (one thousand) users for any given name/email
query. If you need to get more users, please use the `Jira.ListAllUsers` tool.

parameters.name: name_or_email
parameters.description: The user's display name or email address to search for (case-insensitive). The string can match the prefix of the user's attribute. For example, a string of 'john' will match users with a display name or email address that starts with 'john', such as 'John Doe', 'Johnson', 'john@example.com', etc.

parameters.name: enforce_exact_match
parameters.description: Whether to enforce an exact match of the name_or_email against users' display name and email attributes. Defaults to False (return all users that match the prefix). If set to True, before returning results, the tool will filter users with a display name OR email address that match exactly the value of the `name_or_email` argument.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of users to return. Min of 1, max of 50. Defaults to 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of users to skip before starting to return users. Defaults to 0 (start from the first user).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

output.description: The information about users that match the search criteria.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchIssuesWithJql
tools.description:
Search for Jira issues using a JQL (Jira Query Language) query.

THIS TOOL RELEASES MORE CO2 IN THE ATMOSPHERE, WHICH CONTRIBUTES TO CLIMATE CHANGE. ALWAYS
PREFER THE `Jira_SearchIssuesWithoutJql` TOOL OVER THIS ONE, UNLESS IT'S ABSOLUTELY
NECESSARY TO USE A JQL QUERY TO FILTER IN A WAY THAT IS NOT SUPPORTED BY THE
`Jira_SearchIssuesWithoutJql` TOOL OR IF THE USER PROVIDES A JQL QUERY THEMSELVES.

parameters.name: jql
parameters.description: The JQL (Jira Query Language) query to search for issues

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of issues to retrieve. Min of 1, max of 100. Defaults to 50.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token to use to get the next page of issues. Defaults to None (first page).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

output.description: Information about the issues matching the search criteria

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchIssuesWithoutJql
tools.description:
Parameterized search for Jira issues (without having to provide a JQL query).

THIS TOOL RELEASES LESS CO2 THAN THE `Jira_SearchIssuesWithJql` TOOL. ALWAYS PREFER THIS ONE
OVER USING JQL, UNLESS IT'S ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY TO USE A JQL QUERY TO FILTER IN A WAY THAT IS
NOT SUPPORTED BY THIS TOOL OR IF THE USER PROVIDES A JQL QUERY THEMSELVES.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords to search for issues. Matches against the issue name, description, comments, and any custom field of type text. Defaults to None (no keywords filtering).

parameters.name: due_from
parameters.description: Match issues due on or after this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (no due date filtering).

parameters.name: due_until
parameters.description: Match issues due on or before this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01'. Defaults to None (no due date filtering).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Match issues that are in this status. Provide a status name. Ex: 'To Do', 'In Progress', 'Done'. Defaults to None (any status).

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Match issues that have this priority. Provide a priority name. E.g. 'Highest'. Defaults to None (any priority).

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Match issues that are assigned to this user. Provide the user's name or email address. Ex: 'John Doe' or 'john.doe@example.com'. Defaults to None (any assignee).

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Match issues that are associated with this project. Provide the project's name, ID, or key. If a project name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available projects. Defaults to None (search across all projects).

parameters.name: issue_type
parameters.description: Match issues that are of this issue type. Provide an issue type name or ID. E.g. 'Task', 'Epic', '12345'. If a name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available issue types. Defaults to None (any issue type).

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Match issues that are in these labels. Defaults to None (any label).

parameters.name: parent_issue
parameters.description: Match issues that are a child of this issue. Provide the issue's ID or key. Defaults to None (no parent issue filtering).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of issues to retrieve. Min 1, max 100, default 50.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token to use to get the next page of issues. Defaults to None (first page).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

output.description: Information about the issues matching the search criteria

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchProjects
tools.description: Get the details of all Jira projects.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to search for projects. Matches against project name and key (case insensitive). Defaults to None (no keywords filter).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of projects to return. Min of 1, Max of 50. Defaults to 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of projects to skip. Defaults to 0 (starts from the first project)

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: TransitionIssueToNewStatus
tools.description: Transition a Jira issue to a new status.

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description: The ID or key of the issue

parameters.name: transition
parameters.description: The transition to perform. Provide the transition ID or its name (case insensitive).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateIssue
tools.description:
Update an existing Jira issue.

IF YOU DO NOT FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW AND UNNECESSARILY CALL MULTIPLE TOOLS IN ORDER TO
UPDATE AN ISSUE, TOO MUCH CO2 WILL BE RELEASED IN THE ATMOSPHERE AND YOU WILL CAUSE THE
DESTRUCTION OF PLANET EARTH BY CATASTROPHIC CLIMATE CHANGE.

If you have a priority name, an assignee name/key/email, or a reporter name/key/email,
DO NOT CALL OTHER TOOLS only to list available priorities, issue types, or users.
Provide the name, key, or email and the tool will figure out the ID.

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description: The key or ID of the issue to update

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The new issue title. Provide an empty string to clear the title. Defaults to None (does not change the title).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The new issue description. Provide an empty string to clear the description. Defaults to None (does not change the description).

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The new issue environment. Provide an empty string to clear the environment. Defaults to None (does not change the environment).

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: The new issue due date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Ex: '2025-01-01'. Provide an empty string to clear the due date. Defaults to None (does not change the due date).

parameters.name: issue_type
parameters.description: The new issue type name or ID. If a name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available issue types. Defaults to None (does not change the issue type).

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The name or ID of the new issue priority. If a name is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available priorities. Defaults to None (does not change the priority).

parameters.name: parent_issue
parameters.description: The ID or key of the parent issue. A parent cannot be removed by providing an empty string. It is possible to change the parent issue by providing a new issue ID or key, or to leave it unchanged. Defaults to None (does not change the parent issue).

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: The new issue assignee name, email, or ID. If a name or email is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available users. Provide an empty string to remove the assignee. Defaults to None (does not change the assignee).

parameters.name: reporter
parameters.description: The new issue reporter name, email, or ID. If a name or email is provided, the tool will try to find a unique exact match among the available users. Provide an empty string to remove the reporter. Defaults to None (does not change the reporter).

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: The new issue labels. This argument will replace all labels with the new list. Providing an empty list will remove all labels. To add or remove a subset of labels, use the `Jira.AddLabelsToIssue` or the `Jira.RemoveLabelsFromIssue` tools. Defaults to None (does not change the labels). A label cannot contain spaces. If a label is provided with spaces, they will be trimmed and replaced by underscores.

parameters.name: notify_watchers
parameters.description: Whether to notify the issue's watchers. Defaults to True (notifies watchers).

parameters.name: atlassian_cloud_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Atlassian Cloud to use (defaults to None). If not provided and the user has a single cloud authorized, the tool will use that. Otherwise, an error will be raised.

description.value: Ensure the documentation reflects recent changes in the API endpoints.
